about-comic.defaultMessage: Three panel comic titled "MicroPython Rocks" by Mike Rowbit. A cartoon snake introduces Damien, saying "Meet Damien... He created MicroPython.". Two snakes discuss MicroPython. The yellow snake says "MicroPython is designed to work on very small computers." "Like your BBC micro:bit" the purple snake replies." The yellows snake continues "But Python can run anywhere.". The purple snake agrees, saying "Like on this rack of servers that run huge websites". The background behind the snakes shows a server rack.
about-comic.description: Alt text for comic in the about dialog

about-microbit.defaultMessage: Made with love by the <link>Micro:bit Educational Foundation and contributors</link>

about-micropython.defaultMessage: The editor depends on <link>MicroPython</link> which is made by Damien George and a community of developers around the world.

about-read-less-micropython.description: Aria label to collapse an expanded section about MicroPython

about-read-more-micropython.description: Arial label to expand a collapsed section about MicroPython

copied.description: Text shown after copy to clipboard

help-support.description: Menu item for link to support site

ideas-tab.description: Ideas tab button text. Tab shows programs to give students ideas.

ideas-tab-description.defaultMessage: Try out these projects, modify them and get inspired
ideas-tab-description.description: Ideas tab description text. Tab shows programs to give students ideas.

load-error-mixed.defaultMessage: A hex file can only be loaded on its own. It replaces all files in the project.

load-error-mpy.defaultMessage: This version of the Python Editor doesn't currently support adding .mpy files.

load-error-title.description: Title of error dialog when we cannot load files. Uses ICU syntax for pluralisation: https://formatjs.io/docs/core-concepts/icu-syntax/#plural-format.

name-used-when.defaultMessage: The name is used when you download a hex file.

results-count.defaultMessage: {count, plural, =0 {No results} one {# result} other {# results}}

send-hover.defaultMessage: Connect via WebUSB then flash code onto micro:bit

serial-collapse.description: Action label to collapse the serial console/REPL area

serial-ctrl-c-action.description: Button to trigger the Python REPL from the serial area

serial-ctrl-d-action.description: Button to reset the micro:bit from the serial area

serial-expand.description: Action label to expand the serial console/REPL area

serial-flashed.description: Shown when your program is in sync with the micro:bit

serial-help-ctrl-c.defaultMessage: Use the keyboard shortcut <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>C</kbd> to interrupt your program. Then you can type Python commands for MicroPython to run. It's a great way to experiment with something new.
serial-help-ctrl-c.description: Text from the serial hints and tips dialog. kbd tag shows a keyboard key style.

serial-help-ctrl-d.defaultMessage: To start your program running again use <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>D</kbd>.
serial-help-ctrl-d.description: Text from the serial hints and tips dialog.  kbd tag shows a keyboard key style.

serial-help-intro.defaultMessage: The serial terminal shows errors and other output from the program running on your micro:bit. By default, it shows the most recent error from the program. Expand it to see all the output.
serial-help-intro.description: Text from the serial hints and tips dialog

serial-help-print.defaultMessage: Your program can print messages using the print function. Try adding print('micro:bit is awesome') to your program.
serial-help-print.description: Text from the serial hints and tips dialog. code tag shows monospaced font.

serial-help-title.description: Title for the serial hints and tips dialog

serial-hints-and-tips.description: Link/button to open the serial hints and tips dialog

serial-menu.description: Aria label for serial area menu

serial-ready-to-flash.description: Shown when your program is out of sync with the micro:bit

serial-running.description: Indicator text when the micro:bit is running a program

serial-terminal.description: Aria label for the serial terminal

show-api-documentation.description: Shown on link from editor autocomplete and signature help to the API docs.

show-less.description: Show less for general progressive disclosure

show-less-for.description: Show less with item usually for aria label

show-more.description: Show more for general progressive disclosure

show-more-for.description: Show more with item usually for aria label

sidebar.description: Aria label for the area on the left

sidebar-expand.description: Aria label for the expand sidebar button

software-versions.description: Heading for a table of software versions in the about dialog

terms-of-use.description: Terms of use menu option text

timeout-error-title.description: Title for error messages relating to WebUSB timeout

toolkit-error-loading.defaultMessage: An error occurred loading the toolkit.
toolkit-error-loading.description: Error shown if we failed to load toolkit content

toolkit-view-documentation.description: Aria label for the toolkit topic right arrow

transfer-hex-message-one.defaultMessage: Drag the hex file from your Downloads folder to the MICROBIT drive.

transfer-hex-message-two.defaultMessage: Note: You can also Open the hex file later to continue editing.

transfer-hex-title.defaultMessage: Transfer downloaded hex file to micro:bit
transfer-hex-title.description: Title for the transfer hex dialog

undo.description: Aria label for the undo button

unexpected-error-description.defaultMessage: Please try again or <link>raise a support request</link>
unexpected-error-description.description: Progress dialog text telling user that code is being flashed

unexpected-error-title.defaultMessage: Please try again or <link>raise a support request</link>
unexpected-error-title.description: Progress dialog text telling user that code is being flashed

visit-dot-org.defaultMessage: visit microbit.org (opens in a new tab)
visit-dot-org.description: alt text for logo link to .org

webusb-download-instead.defaultMessage: Download the hex file or try Chrome or Microsoft Edge.
webusb-download-instead.description: Shown from the connect action when the user's browser doesn't support WebUSB.

webusb-error-clear-connect-description-1.defaultMessage: Another process is connected to this device.

webusb-error-clear-connect-description-2.defaultMessage: Close any other tabs that may be using WebUSB (e.g. MakeCode, Python Editor), or unplug and replug the micro:bit before trying again.

webusb-error-clear-connect-title.description: Title of error for WebUsb connection

webusb-error-default-title.description: Default title for error messages relating to WebUSB

webusb-error-reconnect-microbit-descript.defaultMessage: Please reconnect your micro:bit and try again.

webusb-error-update-req-description.defaultMessage: You need to <link>update your micro:bit firmware</link> to make use of this feature.
webusb-error-update-req-description.description: WebUSB error telling user to update firmware

webusb-error-update-req-title.description: Error text telling user to update firmware

webusb-not-supported.defaultMessage: Unfortunately, WebUSB is not supported in this browser and your program will be downloaded instead. We recommend Chrome or Microsoft Edge so you can connect directly to your micro:bit.
webusb-not-supported.description: Shown when user's browser doesn't support WebUSB

webusb-why-use.defaultMessage: With WebUSB you can program your micro:bit and connect to the serial console directly from the online editor.
webusb-why-use.description: Shown to encourage use of browser that supports WebUSB

zoom-in-action.description: Text label for zoom in button

zoom-out-action.description: Text label for zoom out button
